text:
“Heavens, Dounia,” Pulcheria Alexandrovna said, relieved.  
“I never thought I’d feel glad to leave.”  
“Mother, he is still very ill. We must be patient.”  
“Patient? You weren’t very patient!”  
“You are just like him,” Pulcheria Alexandrovna continued.  
“Melancholy, haughty, generous… he can’t be an egoist.”  
“Don’t worry, mother. What must be, will be.”  
“What if Pyotr Petrovitch breaks it off?”  
“He won’t be worth much if he does.”  
“We did well to leave,” Pulcheria said quickly.  
“It’s fearfully close in his room.”  
“Where can we get a breath of air?”  
“Good heavens! What a town!”  
“Stay this side, they will crush you!”  
“Why, it’s a piano they have!”  
“How they push!”  
“I’m very much afraid of that.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses relief at leaving a tense situation, while Dounia remains concerned about her brother's health and the potential fallout from their current circumstances.
